title: General Partner
details: Early stage venture capital firm focused on investing in cloud business application companies.  Entrepreneurs value 12 years of business application operating experience, 15 years of venture capital and private equity experience, a highly relevant network, and our institutional investor base.  Our goal is to help entrepreneurs build global category leading cloud business application companies.  Investments include CrowdStrike (CRWD), Zuora (ZUO), ServiceMax (GE for ~$1B), Propel, GoFormz, and DataGrail.

title: Venture Partner
details: Emergence Capital Partners is a Technology Enabled Services venture capital firm.  Firm investments included Yammer (Microsoft), Box (BOX), Insightly, Veeva (VEEV) and ServiceMax (GE) during my tenure.  I developed investment theses, led investments, and served as a Board member.     Sourced and championed the first $2M investment in ServiceMax, served as a board member and recruited the CEO.  GE acquired ServiceMax for ~$1B.  Sourced and led the firm's first $3M investment in Insightly and was the Series A board member.  Sourced and served as the board observer for Box for years.   I started and led the firm's Business Freemium strategy.  Responsible for the firm's business relationships with salesforce.com, Google, Adobe, Intuit, and PayPal.  Led the firm's marketing communications for years.

title: VP AppExchange and Force.com Platform Partners
details: The AppExchange was the world's first business applications marketplace and Force.com was the world's first enterprise grade PaaS.  My AppExchange and Force.com Partner Team was responsible for all partner facing processes from inception. We created the organization, programs and processes to drive the commercial success of the partners on the AppExchange and in their broader relationship with salesforce.com on a global basis. The AppExchange went from zero to nearly one thousand applications on the marketplace during our tenure. More importantly, the AppExchange helped to accelerate the success of what are now SaaS market leaders. Force.com was the first enterprise grade PaaS. My team worked with many companies who built their applications on the Force.com platform and helped them to leverage the salesforce.com customer base and ecosystem.  As a result, I am fortunate to have built a strong network of SaaS executives who partnered with salesforce.com and worked with my AppExchange and Force.com Partner team.  I and we have worked with a number of public and late stage cloud companies on their platform, ISV ecosystem, and marketplace strategies.

title: CEO
details: CEO of Supplier Relationship Management software company serving large industrial customers like Caterpillar, Honeywell and Siemens.  Acquired by Symphony Technology Group (STG).  STG is led by Dr. Romesh Wadhwani, the former CEO of Aspect Development (acquired by i2 for $9B) and an expert in supply chain software.  Investors in Apexon were Tom Bredt of Menlo Ventures, Jim Breyer of Accel, and Dave Stamm the former founder and CEO of Clarify.

title: VP Marketing and Business Development
details: Datasweep was the first to market and the market leader in browser based manufacturing and analytics applications.  I joined as the tenth employee and first non engineer when there were no customers.  Responsible for selling the first 6 customers and all marketing, product marketing, business development and partnerships (Agile).  The company was the market leader in the contract manufacturing (Flextronics, Solectron, Sanmina), telecommunications (Lucent, optical networking), and Medical Device industries (General Electric, Johnson & Johnson, Depuy, Intuitive Surgical).  Rockwell Automation, a world leader in industrial automation, acquired the company.  Investors included Nancy Schoendorf of Mohr Davidow Ventures (MDV), Jim Breyer of Accel, and Roger McNamee of Integral Capital.

title: Product Marketing and Direct Sales
details: Clarify was the market leader in customer support applications serving customers like Cisco, Microsoft, EMC and General Electric.  I led the reverse logistics product line from no customers to market leader and vertical market development.  After that, I was a quota carrying sales executive in the silicon valley territory, exceeded quota, and had a high win rate versus Siebel and other CRM solution providers.  Clarify was acquired by Nortel for $3 billion.

title: Team Leader
details: Cummins Jamestown Engine Plant is where a large percentage of on-highway heavy-duty truck engines in America are made.  This is a team based non-union manufacturing plant that is studied in business schools and benchmarked by companies all over the world.  I led the Flexible Machining CNC low volume parts manufacturing line and co-led the Assembly and Test Operations.  We re engineered our production scheduling systems, and this plant was i2's first automotive account.  This is where I discovered business software from the customer's perspective.

Vice President, Amazon;  Head of Worldwide Sustainability
details: Leading the development and evolution of environmental sustainability and social responsibility at Amazon worldwide. Utilizing Amazon's scale, speed and innovation, the Sustainability organization includes teams executing the work of The Climate Pledge; Sustainable Operations (renewable energy and energy efficiency, buildings); Sustainability Science and Innovation; Social Responsibility and responsible supply chain management; Customer Packaging Experience and Frustration Free Packaging programs; Circular Economy (waste minimization, eWaste, EPR); Sustainable Products and Retail;  Sustainability Technology;, Sustainable Transportation; and social and environmental external engagement and policy setting.

title: CEO
details: The Sustainability Consortium is an organization of companies, academics and civil society organizations working on the science of product sustainability.  Our members represent over $2.4 trillion in revenue in the CPG and retail industries.  Through science-based research and collaboration, TSC drives a new generation of innovative consumer products and responsible supply chains that address environmental, social, and economic issues globally. As CEO, I manage over	50 technical and scientific research staff across US, Europe	and China.TSC was awarded one of Scientific American's "Top Ten World Changing Ideas" for 2012.

title: Vice President
details: Member, BSR’s executive management team. Provided counsel on global strategy, budget and staffing with direct responsibility for multi-million dollar operating budget. Oversaw BSR’s rapid expansion to the East Coast, grants and conferences teams globally. Managed relationships with Rockefeller Foundation and global multilateral partners, including UN and US State Department.  Directed BSR’s  conference team and events (regularly 1,000+ participants), including direct  work  and coaching with many company CEOs and elected officials. External spokesperson  for BSR and regular speaker at leading sustainability and social investment events.

title: Managing Director, East Coast
details: Lead BSR's work on the East Coast, US - New York and Washington, DC offices. Work with key stakeholders and multinational member companies to integrate corporate responsibility into core business functions.

title: Executive Director
details: One of Silicon Valley's first social enterprises, OpenVoice was a spin-off of Plugged In.  Created as a public-private partnership between OpenVoice (a 501.c.3), AOL and Sun Microsystems, OpenVoice trained youth in East Palo Alto on digital media skills, creative writing and analytical thinking. OpenVoice staff were the engine behind building out AOL's first teen channel and created other web 1.0 properties such as 49ers Steve Young's the "Young Zone" - one of the first online portals targeted at youth and philanthropy.  OpenVoice also partnered with web 1.0 companies to place youth from socio-economic backgrounds in hard-to-access internships and higher paying technology jobs.

title: Manager, Corporate and Foundation Relations

Created multidisciplinary pilot program for students with behavioral and learning disorders looking to mainstream into public school classrooms.
